#summary Which python-gdata versions to use and why
#labels Featured

= Introduction =

Currently, _only the following versions_ of python-gdata fully support uploading arbitrary file types to Google Docs via googlecl. 

2.0.10<br>
2.0.12<br>
2.0.13<br>
2.0.14<br>

<br>
<br>
The following versions of python-gdata support uploading _some_ file types, like text files, but do not support uploading arbitrary file types (like PDFs).

2.0.0<br>
2.0.1<br>
2.0.2<br>
2.0.3<br>
2.0.4<br>

<br>
<br>
The following versions of python-gdata do not support uploading *anything* to Google Docs.

2.0.5<br>
2.0.6<br>
2.0.7<br>
2.0.8<br>
2.0.9<br>
2.0.11<br>
<br>
<br>

= Details =

For more details (and one helpful table), please see the following blog posts:

<a href="http://credentiality2.blogspot.com/2011/11/untangling-gdata.html">Credentiality's post</a> has the gdata table.
<br>
<a href="http://atechyblog.blogspot.com/2011/11/python-gdata.html">Coilamg's post</a> has several potential error messages.
